q: At the launch of Labour's 90 page election manifesto in the href="http://searchtopics.independent.ie/topic/Aviva_Stadium"> Aviva Stadium yesterday, Mr Eamon Gilmore strongly attacked Fine Gael's href="http://searchtopics.independent.ie/topic/Michael Noonan_Michael Noonan_%28politician%29"> Michael Noonan for claiming that Labour was a high-tax party. Labour will not increase tax on people earning under? 100,000, he said. Mr Eamon Gilmore , whose slogan of`` Eamon Gilmore for Taoiseach'' has been questioned in recent days, made it clear that his party was still campaigning to become the biggest party in Government.
